Career Fair FAQ     About         About   The Engineering and Computer Science Career Fair is one of the largest career fairs at UIC. Previous Engineering and Computer Science Career Fairs have drawn over 100 companies and over 2,000 students to the career fair.  It is a wonderful opportunity for employers to recruit entry-level full-time engineers as well as summer interns, co-op students, or even part-time positions or contract positions.  We encourage you to review our Fall 2019 enrollment to learn more about the number of students in each engineering major at UIC.          Career Fair Location & Parking         Location      The Engineering and Computer Science Career Fair will be hosted in the UIC Forum , located at: 725 W. Roosevelt Rd.  Complimentary parking is provided to all registered employers in the Maxwell Street Parking Structure located at: 701 West Maxwell St.  Parking validation is provided at the employer check-in desk.  To drop off career fair materials, we recommend driving to the rear entrance of the Forum located on S. Union Ave. Career fair staff will be there to take your items to your table. You can then continue on to the Maxwell Street Parking Structure to park your vehicle. For companies interested in 24×36 posters and PowerPoint slides, it is ideal if the company provides its own digital design. The UIC Engineering Career Center is happy to print and mount 24×36 posters, and add PowerPoint slides to rotating presentations. A member of our team will follow-up with each company individually to ensure your purchased marketing is to your liking.  Please note that there is limited availability for push notifications and 24×36 posters. This website will be updated once those items are sold out.   $150: Three push notifications and a designation as a “featured” employer in our career fair app .  $250: One 24×36 inch poster displayed in high-traffic area during career fair and ONE PowerPoint slide to be looped on two large projectors during career fair.  $350: Three weekly email blasts leading up to the career fair and ONE PowerPoint slide to be looped on two large projectors during career fair.   For additional questions about marketing opportunities during the career fair, please contact Michelle Mittelman at mittel@uic.edu . Tips for Recruiters         tips   As visitors to the UIC campus, you expected to abide by University policies, including sexual harassment policies.  Before the Career Fair:   Complete all registration career fair details carefully. Information provided in your registration (company name, website, positions hiring for, etc.) will be shared with students in the career fair booklet, on the Engineering Career Center website, and our weekly e-newsletter.  We strongly encourage you to post the positions you are recruiting for in UICcareers.com . UICcareers.com is our internal job board exclusively for UIC students and recent alumni. We recommend including information about your presence at the UIC Engineering and Computer Science Career Fair in the position descriptions that you post on UICcareers.com.  If possible, we strongly encourage you to invite UIC alumni working in your companies to help staff your table during the career fair. Alumni ribbons are available at the employer check-in desks and can be a great conversation starter with UIC students.   During the Career Fair:   Please engage with students. Standing in front of your table and welcoming students to speak with you can help to create more meaningful and productive conversations.  If you are open to being contacted by students, consider bringing business cards, or cards with a general company email address on them. Students will feel much better about having a name, or at least an email, to follow-up on applications with.   After the Career Fair:   Contact students you are interested in quickly!  Consider other ways to engage with UIC students on campus via Pop-Up tables, Info Sessions, Tech Talks, On-Campus Interviews, and more.  Contact us if you would like to learn more about additional engagement opportunities on campus, or to hear about additional upcoming career fairs hosted at UIC.
